titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 82: Vitae patrum (Lives of the Fathers)
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

notesStmt.note: De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York,: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2046, no. 119.

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), p. 89, no. 82.

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript contains a copy of Vitae patrum dated 1464.

support.watermark: Very clear watermark on fol. 132r; possibly Tower

supportDesc.extent: i+132+i; 315 x 220 mm bound to 327 x 226 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto; earlier foliation upper center margin recto

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled in ink; two columns of forty-two to forty-eight lines; written area: 223 x 141 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Blank spaces left for initials; rubrication throughout
Inside front coverBookplate, John Frederick Lewis

history.provenance: Leander van Ess (1772-1847), Darmstadt, no. 184; sold in 1824 to Sir Thomas Phillipps (1792-1872), no. 526; his sale Sotheby's, London, June 6, 1910, 817, to Bull; John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
